ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Question about Marinov, Westbrook, Pitz scheme
ygData.msgSnippet: Arief, If I m not mistaken, you can enter the reaction twice, making sure to declare them as duplicate reactions, and give each declaration one of the two

Arief,

If I'm not mistaken, you can enter the reaction twice, making sure to
declare them as "duplicate" reactions, and give each declaration one
of the two terms as separate arrhenius rates; when cantera calculates
the reaction rates, it will take the sum of the two rates.  Page 37
of 'cti.pdf' in the cantera documentation explains it better.

Just as an example of how to declare duplicate reactions, this is
from the 'ptcombust.cti' file that comes with cantera (though the
rates aren't both arrhenius, here):

#  Reaction 4
surface_reaction("O2 + 2 PT(S) => 2 O(S)",   
                  Arrhenius(1.80000E+21, -0.5, 0),
                  options = 'duplicate')

#  Reaction 5
surface_reaction( "O2 + 2 PT(S) => 2 O(S)",   
                  stick(2.30000E-02, 0, 0),
                  options = 'duplicate')


As an aside, I'm not sure if there's a typo in your email, but the
two exponential terms in your email are exactly the same 
{ "exp(+1.629/RT)" }, in which case you could just factor them out to
get one rate.

Regards,
Steven




--- aedahoe <ae.dahoe@...> wrote:

> 
> Dear Colleagues,
> 
> 
> Reaction 15 of Marinov, Westbrook, Pitz scheme
> has the following expression for the reaction
> rate: k = 4.2e14*exp(+1.629/RT)+1.30e11*exp(+1.629/RT)
> 
> How can this be included in the .cti file?
> 
> With best regards,
> 
> Arief
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
